publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-753 Keith Brown: 100 Years Since Scotland’s First Woman Councillor—That the Parliament recognises the achievement of Mrs Lavinia Malcolm who was elected as a town councillor in Dollar on 6 November 1907 in the first election where women could be candidates; notes The Scotsman’s naming of her the next day as "the only lady in Scotland returned as a Town Councillor"; further notes that in 1913 she was the first woman in Scotland to be elected as a Provost; congratulates the Dollar Museum for maintaining her memory, and looks forward to the day when all groups in society are fairly represented within our democracy. Supported by: Alasdair Allan*, Hugh Henry*, Bob Doris*, Stuart McMillan*, Jamie Hepburn*, Patricia Ferguson*, Rob Gibson*, Michael Matheson*, Elizabeth Smith*, Kenneth Gibson*, Brian Adam*, Sandra White*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Bill Kidd*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Joe FitzPatrick*
